result.execSummary:
Robert Ritchie Jr. was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Ritchie Jr. is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Court Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Court Trial

records.addlTxt:
9:16 am  Defendant Robert Ritchie appeared, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:17 am  Mr. Ritchie requests exclusion of witnesses.
9:17 am  ADA Leusink designates Officer Brandl as his court officer and pursuant to Chap 950 the victim is allowed to remain in courtroom.
9:19 am  Court makes a record of Sec 906.15 exclusion of witnesses.
9:21 am  Peter Bukouras duly sworn and testified on direct exam of ADA Leusink.
9:22 am  Record reflects accurate identification of defendant by witness.
9:31 am  Exh 1 marked and identified by witness.
9:31 am  Exh 1offered and received without objection.  
9:32 am  Exh 2 marked, identified, offered and received without objection.
9:32 am  Exh 1 played for Court.
9:38 am  Continued direct exam of Mr. Bukouras by ADA Leusink.
9:40 am  Exh 3 marked and identified.
9:42 am  Exh 3 offered into evidence and received without objection.
9:43 am  Exh 4 marked, identified and offered into evidence.  Court receives without objection.
9:44 am  Exh 5 marked, identified and offered into evidence.  Court receives without objection.
9:48 am  Cross exam by Mr. Ritchie.
10:03 am  Redirect by ADA Leusink.
10:04 am  Court questions witness.
10:04 am  Officer Grady Worland, City of Elkhorn PD, duly sworn and testified on direct exam of ADA Leusink.
10:08 am  Record reflects accurate identification of defendant by witness.
10:09 am  No cross.
10:09 am  Court questions witness.
10:10 am  Sgt Alvin Brandl, City of Elkhorn PD, duly sworn and testified on direct exam of ADA Leusink.
10:13 am  Cross by Mr. Ritchie.
10:20 am  No redirect. 
10:20 am  State rests.
10:20 am  Mr. Ritchie moves for dismissal.
10:20 am  Response by ADA Leusink.
10:21 am  Taking in light most favorable to the State, court finds there is probable cause to believe a crime may have been committed and declines to grant motion.
10:22 am  Robert Ritchie, Jr. given oath of affirmation and is questioned by the Court.
10:25 am  Mr. Ritchie steps off the witness stand to indicate on Exh 3 where he was located on the night of the incident.
10:27 am  Cross exam by ADA Leusink.
10:31 am  Court questions Mr. Ritchie as follow-up to ADA Leusink's questions.
10:35 am  Argument by ADA Leusink.
10:38 am  Argument by Mr. Ritchie.
10:39 am  Court having heard the testimony and arguments of both sides and taking into consideration JI 140, for all the reasons stated on the record, finds defendant not guilty.

2:59 pm  Defendant Robert Ritchie appeared, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:59 pm  Mr.  Ritchie has obtained squad video from City of Elkhorn PD and is no longer pursuing motion.
2:59 pm  State has witnesses available for court trial on June 22, 2018.
3 pm  Mr. Ritchie indicates to Court that discovery is complete and he has provided State with his witness list.
3:02 pm  No other pretrial issues.

3:02 pm  Parties to appear at 8:30 a.m. on June 22, 2018.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH PETER BUKOURAS.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
